company.name: Training and Consultancy in Planning, Monitoring, Evaluation and Learning

profile_positions.company: Training and Consultancy in Planning, Monitoring, Evaluation and Learning
profile_positions.description: Training sessions on understanding and using Log Frames (Mainline), Theory of Change in daily practices (Robert Carr civil society Network Funds) and an evaluation of a capacity building project using Outcome Mapping (ADPC).
profile_positions.title: Freelance Consultant

profile_positions.description:
The EU funded Financing Sustainable Futures project with 7 European organizations and 3 from Brazil, Costa Rica and Uganda aims to raise awareness and mobilize European citizens to support fair financial and investment systems that cohere with development policies. 
In addition, as advisor on Planning, Monitoring, Evaluation and Learning issues, I’m involved in the design and implementation of the five-year planning process of the Federation.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description: My contribution to ADPC was to design the integration of Outcome Mapping for the monitoring of progress in one of their capacity building programmes. Furthermore, I facilitated a Strategic Planning process and wrote a project proposal on development, migration and climate change.
profile_positions.title: Monitoring & Evaluation Expert

profile_positions.description: Responsible for continuity in the implementation of the Fair Green and Global Alliance programme of ActionAid NL in Kenya, South Africa and Zimbabwe, involving project and financial management, on an interim basis. In addition I contributed with the development of reporting and review formats.
profile_positions.title: Project and Financial Officer

profile_positions.description:
Trainer Project Cycle Management Course, a 4-week course for programme managers and coordinators of development organizations involved in the strategic supervision of projects and programmes.
Consultancy: “Lessons learned: Increasing Aid Effectiveness in Civil Society Organisations initiative in West Uganda”, a report for Hivos 
Provided training in tailor-made Project Cycle Management to migrant organisations
Provided training in Outcome Mapping
Provided training in Management for Development Results 
Provided training in Writing Winning Proposals
profile_positions.title: Trainer/Consultant

profile_positions.description:
After a reorganisation in 2005, I became a Programme Officer, responsible for relation management with partners in East Africa and for participatory development of strategies to support agricultural sustainable economic development. One such bottom-up, participatory process was the development of a Regional Framework for Development in West Uganda. The support to the setting up and growth of the organic agriculture sectors in Tanzania and Kenya included the development of value chains and stimulating Private Public Partnerships and tailor made capacity building of partners in these areas. I’ve set up evaluations and gave presentations at workshops, conferences and seminars. Support to organic and fair trade agriculture involved also support to IFOAM at the worldwide level and to training organizations at the local level. 
I greatly enjoyed designing and facilitating tailor made trainings in quality management systems with training organisations, networks and producer groups to empower them in participating in value-chains.
profile_positions.title: Programme Officer Sustainable Production

profile_positions.description:
My first work for Hivos was on an interim basis to manage the Biodiversity Fund and to manage relationships with partners in Asia working on environmental issues (April-September 2001). 

I started to work as a Sector Specialist Environment for Bureau Africa in 2002, advising colleagues at the Head Office and in Harare on environmental aspects related to projects. Part of the responsibility was to contribute to policy development on sustainability issues and translate these to specific policy for Africa, strategic development, building up of a portfolio, initiating studies, workshops, and campaigns. One of the topics was genetic modification and I initiated a series of workshops and studies to support the lobby and awareness raising on socio-economic and environmental effects of genetic engineering, as well as capacity building activities with networks and organisations on biodiversity and local variety seed systems. Biodiversity initiatives in Eastern and South Africa were added to the portfolio.
At that time (2001-2003) I became a board member of the Dutch Platform Gene Technology (NPG). Environment and economy policies of Hivos were merged and the focus on inclusive commercialisation of agriculture increased. One of the activities was to organize a strategic workshop on commercialisation of the organic agriculture sector in Zambia and one spin-off was a Private Public Partnerships (PPP) with Woolworths in South Africa. After a fact finding mission a long term strategic plan for development of value chains in the context of the Black Economic Empowerment programme, involving smallholder farmers producing organic food for Woolworths was established. 
In addition to my work as Sector Specialist Environment, I coordinated EU projects for Bureau Africa.
profile_positions.title: Sector Specialist Environment at Bureau Africa

profile_positions.description:
My work for Both Ends started with matching requests from Southern Civil Society Organisations with Northern Institutions, including donors, and with some research assignments. Other activities, such as raising awareness on environmental and development issues as part of the UNCED process in the Netherlands, and organizing meetings were added. I was involved in setting up workshops and awareness raising activities on food security, water and multi-functional land use (FAO, World Water Forum II) and expert meetings. 
In 1993, I acted as an interim Sector Specialist Environment at Oxfam Novib.
As coordinator Sustainable Land Use, I was involved in the negotiation for the United Nations Convention to Combat Desertification and mitigating the effects of Drought (UNCCD). I organized an NGO workshop in Geneva, leading to the set up of the international NGO network on desertification: RIOD. The aim was to contribute effectively to the UNCCD by bringing in issues of concern to civil society. I was in the steering group, organizing advocacy and lobby activities, workshops, donor meetings, media events and Open Dialogue Sessions in the Conference of Parties (COPs), publications and media kits. During that time I gave many presentations of the subject. One of the workshops was on gender mainstreaming and strengthening the role of women in the implementation of UNCCD, which led to become a co-writer of a training manual on gender mainstreaming that UNSO/UNDP used to give training in many countries.
Besides board member of RIOD (international and EU level), I was elected as a board member for ELCI (Environmental Liaison Centre International), and as a European representative to the IFAD – NGO consultations.
I was invited to join the official Dutch Delegation to UNCCD and was added to the Rooster of Experts of UNCCD.
profile_positions.title: Sustainable Land Use and Desertification
